what: Using gpt-4o-mini to condense an example report
title: llm4np: language modeling for neuropsychology reports
text: code run without modifications, environment variable OPENAI_API_KEY must valid setting. retrieved example PDF neuropsychological (NP) evaluation thepeerconsult.com. Note: parse_nppdf may emit warnings errors table parsing phase. refer non-existent files, seem false positives. ignored. parse_nppdf uses pdftools tabulapdf extract text tables reports. paste report text single character vector convenient processing. also view autism ontology based 2015 paper Alexa McCray colleages. Now create agent prompted use ontology summary NP evaluation. now use templated prompt, using report text ontology summary. George Smith highly gifted 12-year-old diagnosed Autism Spectrum Disorder, ADHD, anxiety, exhibiting exceptional cognitive abilities, especially verbal, nonverbal, spatial problem-solving (PTO: “Cognitive Ability”). performance aligns typical high school graduate, demanding tailored educational support (PTO: “Learning Disorders”). Despite strengths, George faces considerable challenges primarily executive functioning, slow processing speed (PTO: “Attention Deficit Disorder Hyperactivity”), social communication, impacting peer interactions emotional regulation (PTO: “Emotional Outbursts”). rigidity low tolerance change complicate transitions flexibility (PTO: “Reaction Unexpected Change”). Socially, George’s enthusiasm unique interests may hinder relationship development, struggles engagement perspective-taking (PTO: “Recognition Social Norms”). often unaware social cues tends dominate conversations interests (PTO: “Immoderate Behavior”), increasing isolation anxiety (PTO: “Social Anxiety”). Ongoing support home school crucial nurturing George’s social skills, emotional wellbeing, executive functioning (PTO: “Emotional Regulation Control”). Strategies may include structured activities, specialized social skills training, accommodations processing speed within Individualized Education Program (IEP) (PTO: “Primary Diagnosis”). Overall, George compelling blend strengths vulnerabilities requiring integrated support thrive academically socially (PTO: “Social Competence”). Continuous assistance providing structure understanding unique needs ensure can leverage remarkable abilities effectively (PTO: “Planning”). Strengths include: Cognitive Ability (PTO: “Cognitive Ability”), Learning Disorders (PTO: “Learning Disorders”), Emotional Regulation Control (PTO: “Emotional Regulation Control”), Social Competence (PTO: “Social Competence”). Weaknesses include: Attention Deficit Disorder Hyperactivity (PTO: “Attention Deficit Disorder Hyperactivity”), Immoderate Behavior (PTO: “Immoderate Behavior”), Reaction Unexpected Change (PTO: “Reaction Unexpected Change”), Emotional Outbursts (PTO: “Emotional Outbursts”). Needs include: Primary Diagnosis (PTO: “Primary Diagnosis”), Social Competence (PTO: “Social Competence”), Planning (PTO: “Planning”).
code: library(wizrd) library(llm4np) pretty_rmd <- function(x) {     x |> strwrap() |> paste(">", text = _, collapse = "\n") |> cat() } nelsonasd = system.file("pdfs", "nelsonAutDeid.pdf", package="llm4np") nels = parse_nppdf(nelsonasd) ## Error : '4.  Educators are also likely to be best able to support George’s emotional, behavioral, and social functioning' does not exist in current working directory ('/Users/vincentcarey/AUTISM/llm4np/vignettes'). ## Error : '    ognitive Skills             ' does not exist in current working directory ('/Users/vincentcarey/AUTISM/llm4np/vignettes'). nels ## Parsed NP pdf with 14 pages and 5 tables. nt = gsub("\\n", " ", paste(nels@text, collapse=" ")) substr(nt,1130,1210) ## [1] " is a highly gifted 12 year-old boy who is experiencing social, executive functio" data(nmdf) head(nmdf) ##         tag                                           val ## 1 Class_634                 Obstetric Delivery Procedures ## 2 Class_385                             Perinatal History ## 3 Class_464 Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity ## 4 Class_455                              Mental Disorders ## 5 Class_689                   Psychiatric Hospitalization ## 6 Class_138                       Psychologic Indications ag = openai_agent("gpt-4o-mini") |>     instruct("You are a helpful assistant with training in neuropsychology.") ag ## <wizrd::Agent> gpt-4o-mini ## @instructions: You are a helpful assistant with training in neuropsychology. ## @io: <wizrd::PlainTextFormat> → ← <wizrd::PlainTextFormat> ## @tools:  ## @params:  ## @backend: <wizrd::OpenAIAPIServer> https://api.openai.com prompted_agent <- ag |> prompt_as("Please summarize the text {txt} in five short paragraphs      of at most 45 words.  Use the concepts in the 'val' field of {df} as much as possible,      choosing the most specific term that is relevant, and when you do use these terms, please      append the associated value of the 'tag' field in parentheses, prefixing the tag with      'PTO:'.  After producing the paragraphs, please produce three lists of tags that were      used, corresponding to 'strengths', 'weaknesses' and 'needs'.  Do not use headings with      the lists, just provide the lists as sentences preceded by the category.")  prompted_agent |> predict(list(txt=nt, df=nmdf)) |> pretty_rmd()

what: A second example, no autism diagnosis present
title: llm4np: language modeling for neuropsychology reports
text: Joe 8-year-old boy history premature birth, Tourette Syndrome, Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD). Current assessments reveal concerns attentional control, impacting academic performance. Joe positive family background faces developmental delays. Observations assessment showed Joe appeared engaged, cooperative, communicative, yet attention disrupted verbal overflow. cognitive assessment indicates borderline intellectual functioning, attention, executive function, motor control significant areas difficulty. Language abilities variable; spontaneous speech adequate, receptive expressive skills showed weaknesses due attentional issues. Nonverbal processing visual memory also presented challenges, particularly tasks requiring complex integration. Joe’s adaptive skills ratings age expectations, indicating difficulties self-regulation, planning, task organization. medical history includes medication anxiety impulsivity, faces ongoing challenges related ADHD Tourette syndrome, influencing overall academic trajectory. Recommendations suggest continuing small group instruction reading math, external support task organization, accommodations testing due processing speed. Regular follow-ups health educational providers essential ongoing monitoring support. Strengths: Joe displays good verbal fluency (PTO: Ability Convey Information), cooperative assessments (PTO: Personal Traits), shows appropriate articulation (PTO: Expressive Language). Weaknesses: attentional deficits (PTO: Attention Focus), struggles executive function (PTO: Executive Function), motor control difficulties (PTO: Gross Motor Skills). Needs: Joe requires small group instruction academics (PTO: Performance School), needs behavioral support planning (PTO: Planning), benefits structured routines home (PTO: Home Life Skills).
code: sqspf = system.file("pdfs", "de-identified+report+1.pdf", package="llm4np") sq = parse_nppdf(sqspf) txt2 = gsub("\\n", " ", paste(sq@text, collapse=" "))  # concatenate text prompted_agent |> predict(list(txt=txt2, df=nmdf)) |> pretty_rmd()
